conclusion: Analyze the v-t graph to calculate displacement over time.
The graph shows velocity as a function of time; area under graph represents displacement.
From 0 to 1 second, displacement is 2 meters.
From 1 to 2 seconds, displacement is 1 meter.
From 2 to 3 seconds, displacement is -1 meter.
Total displacement from 0 to 3 seconds is 2 meters.
Since displacement is not zero, the particle has not returned to the starting point.
Final answer: No, the particle has not returned to its starting point at the 3-second mark.
